alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Indian River County through 415 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gifford. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sebastian, Vero Beach, Indian River Shores, Vero Beach South and Gifford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
